content: the court in prato has made a final ruling in a case involving the dissolution of a hereditary community and the allocation of a property the property is a ground floor apartment with four main rooms a kitchenette a toilet a storage room and an entrance hall it also has two exclusive courtyards and an unfinished attic room with a total area of 12100 square meters the court has declared the hereditary community dissolved and has ordered the property to be allocated to the parties involved the current owners are three individuals who inherited it from their deceased mother the court has assigned ownership shares to each party and has ordered the payment of certain sums of money between them the court has determined the market value of the property to be €120000 additionally the court has ordered the payment of an occupation indemnity to one party and has offset this amount against the sums owed between the parties the court has also determined the costs of the case and has ordered each party to pay their respective shares the property was originally registered in the cadastre buildings municipality and had building permits issued in 1957 and 1962 despite some nonconformities in the construction a building concession was granted in 2016 the tribunal has assigned the property to the plaintiffs and has ordered the defendants to pay compensation and settlement amounts the court costs will be divided between the parties and the defendants will also have to reimburse the plaintiffs for their litigation costs
